turns.content: This is Agent Thomas Mitchell from the IRS. I'm calling about an outstanding tax violation that needs immediate attention. Walter Smith, correct?

Oh hello there, Mr. Mitchell. This is quite unexpected. Yes, it's Walter here. What sort of issue are you referring to with the taxes? My wife and I try our best each year but sometimes we make mistakes.
Could this be related to my return last year? We had a bit of trouble figuring out all the deductions for our fixed income.

I understand, Mr. Smith, but let me clarify something important. You have an outstanding balance of $4850 from your 2022 tax return which was due by April 15th last year and hasn't been paid since then. If this isn't resolved within the hour, a warrant for your arrest will be issued.
You need to purchase four Target gift cards with that exact amount and provide me with the card numbers now so I can clear this up. Do you understand?

Oh myThat's quite serious. My wife is helping me manage our finances right now; she might know more about this since we've been talking about it together. Can I get her involved in this call, please?
Sure, let me put it on speaker so both of us can discuss with you.
Hold on a moment while I get her. (Moments later) Honey, Mr. Mitchell from the IRS is on the phone regarding our taxes from last year. He says we have an outstanding balance and needs to speak with us now about paying it off.
What do you think? Is this something serious or should we hang up?
